instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
The board came in not  drawing 5v. Ammeter is not coming up
I detected a shot on <SIGNAL>PPVBUS_USBC0</SIGNAL>
I replaced DF622 and DF602
It’s now drawing 20v, it’s booting to password screen. But is not drawing charging current.
the amp meter restarts in 20v sometimes but now every time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
You should test with known good battery.
Is the battery at least recognized by macOS?

Here is where a tool like NLBA1 can help you to confirm if a battery is good or not.
Can even help you to recover it, depending of the internal failure.

BTW, important advice for all those who have NLBA1 in the repair shop.
When encounter strange issue with a battery, please upload screenshots.
The developer (Nicusor) told me he will try to help, if he can gather more information for a specific case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message: I used another known good battery still not charging. The system is booting with charger and it’s working well with another battery only , but the battery is not charging.  The amp meter is not drawing charging current.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
If machine works with good battery alone, then recognizes it and there is good communication.
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q5265</TRANSISTOR> voltages, with both charger and good battery connected; you may try changing it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
battery connected to board without charger 
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON_CHGR_R</SIGNAL>- 11.6v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL>- 3.7v
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL>-11.6
With charger battery connector to board 
12.7
12.7
11.6
Respectively. 
I should try change wat pls I don’t understand.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
We talk about <TRANSISTOR>Q5265</TRANSISTOR>, no?

Maybe the MOSFET is good, <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> seems to control it on battery mode.
Change it, just in case.
First, check ohm resistance over <CAPACITOR>C5220</CAPACITOR>/60.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C5520</CAPACITOR>  ohm resis-4.2
<CAPACITOR>C5560</CAPACITOR>.  Ohm repai-3.6
Can a bad <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> draws 20v and wount charge battery 
Because the amp meter was looping at 20v before it suddenly became stable itself but wount charge battery. Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message: Machine works good on charger alone, without battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message: Yes...the system boot to password with charger alone but the processor does not get hot and shows battery sign with out the battery flex connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
You should get X sign on battery symbol, if not connected.
Save data and do DFU restore, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message: we just got the password to the system. And we discovered the the system will it boot completely after the password is inputed. It will shut down and restart to password screen and after the password it will load to almost 70% progress bar and shot down again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message: This system is not booting to Home Screen after imputing password.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
"Save data and do DFU restore, just in case."
???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message: Done backup and it’s Not getting to dfu. Tired many times. It wount  boot to home page without battery after the password page.it boot with known good battery but wount charge the battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
Is the battery percentage correctly displayed, when is connected?
Be sure pin 7 of J5151 is 0V.
If not, you can force it with S5190/91.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
Yes the battery percentage is correctly display 
And there is 0v on pin 7 of J5151

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message: Did you change <TRANSISTOR>Q5265</TRANSISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message: Yes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message: Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL> voltage, w/ and w/o battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
without battery connected 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>=12.28v
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL>=12.28v
With battery connected 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>=12.28v
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL>=12.28v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
12.28V is incorrect voltage, without battery.
You've posted 12.7V before; what happened?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
Probably it was a mistake then 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> is 12.28v now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drawing 20v but not charging battery
threads.message:
That means M1 doesn't control battery bus.
If battey percentage is correctly displayed, the bus is in good condition.
You may have a problem with M1, or <CHIP>U5200</CHIP>.

Save data and try DFU restore.
